intro: Malacothrix saxatilis var. altissima, commonly known as the alpine wall-rue, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small white to yellowish flowers. This variety is notable for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
